Name: Stela/relief fragment
Description: A fragment from either a relief or stela of limestone, depicting the deities Osiris and Hathor, both facing right. Osiris wears the white crown of Upper Egypt, trimmed with feathers, and carries the crook and flagellum. Hathor wears a long tunic tied beneath the breast, a headdress of cow horns and a sun-disk which is surmounted by a pendant uraeus. Her left arm is reaching out to touch Osiris' right shoulder. Between the two figures is a set of hieroglyphs giving the name of the goddess.Traces of yellow paint remain on the figures and in the inscription.
